meanings.definition: The plural form of the noun 'rhus', referring to a genus of plants in the sumac family.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, you can see different types of rhuses growing together.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study various rhuses to understand their characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The rhuses in the park seemed to be chatting with each other in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: The rhuses in the forest stood tall like a united family, providing shade and beauty.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the rhuses made the garden look like a painting come to life.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'rhus', meaning to apply a substance to the skin to relieve itching or irritation.
meanings.sent1: She always carries a tube of rhuses in her bag for insect bites.
meanings.sent2: After hiking, he quickly uses rhuses to soothe his sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The rhuses worked like magic, calming the redness on her skin instantly.
meanings.sent4: Applying rhuses felt like a cool breeze on his irritated skin.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the rhuses was so refreshing, it felt like a spa treatment at home.
